Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Dermaseptin-DI1 (Dermaseptin DI1, DRS-DI1, dermadistinctin K, DDK, DD K; Ala-rich; UCLL1; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: the Brazilian frog Phyllomedusa distincta, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against E.faecalis (MIC>19 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 2.4 uM), E. coli (MIC 0.6 uM), S. aureus (MIC 4.7 uM). Hemolysis > 32 uM. Also provided by Erik Martin.Structure: 3D structure determined in DPC micelles (Verly RM et al. 2009 Biophys. J 96: 2194-2203).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. It's located on the membrane surface. Updated 2/2014; 7/2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Batista CV, da Silva LR, Sebben A, Scaloni A, Ferrara L, Paiva GR, Olamendi-Portugal T, Possani LD, Bloch C Jr1999
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the Brazilian frog Phyllomedusa distincta.
